definition: to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: The antagonism of moralities is an important factor to influence world harmony.
sentences.chinese: 道德的對立是影響世界和諧的重要因素。

sentences.english: The opposite of acids are bases, or alkaloids.
As Mars moves opposite your sign, you could feel listless and depressed about love.
sentences.chinese: 火星與你對立，你可能對愛心生怠倦和沮喪。

sentences.english: Modern English empiricists take experience and natural as two opposed conceptions.
sentences.chinese: 英國近代經驗論者，將經驗和自然對立起來。

sentences.english: The tale wittily explores the interaction and tension between reality and imagination.
sentences.chinese: 這篇故事機智地探討了現實和想象之間的聯繫和對立。

sentences.english: Each door opens onto another country. We readers have unprecedented rights of access to complementary and contradictory worlds.
sentences.chinese: 作爲讀者，我們有權進入互不相同或完全對立的世界。

sentences.english: On others, such as global warming, the two countries are at opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 在全球變暖等其它問題上，兩國更是處於對立的兩級。

sentences.english: Crime and moral exist in a connective form of both contact and contradiction.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪與道德是互相對立而又相互聯繫的矛盾體。

sentences.english: It is time for opposing factions to unite and work towards a common goal.
sentences.chinese: 現在是各對立派聯合起來爲共同目標而奮鬥的時候了。

sentences.english: The antagony between the necessity and freedom of nature is an original contradiction man faces.
sentences.chinese: 自然必然性與自由的對立，是人類面臨的本原性矛盾。

sentences.english: But the epoch of the bourgeoisie simplified the class antagonisms.
sentences.chinese: 但是，資產階級時代的新時代卻使階級對立簡單化了。

sentences.english: He invents a special term to describe the opposite of autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 他發明了一個術語來描述自主的對立面。

sentences.english: Many people pose tradition and modernization as diametrically opposite.
sentences.chinese: 許多人將傳統與現代化絕然對立起來。

sentences.english: The peace talks broke down completely, and the two opposing parties took up arms again.
sentences.chinese: 和平會談徹底破裂，對立雙方再起干戈。

definition: conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
conflict/to conflict/clash of opposing forces/collision (of interests)/contention
